page.title: 03WITHYGROW'S FARM - 1
page.content: Withygrow's Farm covers 62 acres. It is the smallest farm in the parish. It is a mixed farm owned by Mr & Mrs Whittaker. There are cattle and sheep and they also grow potatoes. Hereford cattle are used for beef and for dairying. Fodder beet is grown for the cows to eat in winter. The cowshed is 33 years old and houses a bulk tank. Each cow's milk goes into different bottles where it is weighed before being stored in the refridgerated tank. The milk is sent to Stonehouse Creamery and thence to London. The calves go in the old cowsheds. The cattle are fed on cattle cake and also hay and barley treated hydroponically. There are 39 sheep, one ram and,at present, 20 lambs. The lambs are fattened for market. The farm has its own sheep-dip used by other farmers.
